description: All SAP tables related to Azure Sentinel.

tables.name: ABAPAuditLog
tables.description: SAP security audit log is used to keep records of important user transactions and system events within an SAP system. This table stores information such as who accessed the system, which transactions were executed, and when. It provides a useful tool for monitoring activity and detecting potential security breaches.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Date and time when the record was generated

columns.name: UpdatedOn
columns.description: The date and time of the event occured in the SAP system in UTC format.

columns.name: SystemId
columns.description: The SystemId is a unique identifier for a specific SAP system. It is a three-character alphanumeric code that is used to distinguish between different SAP systems.

columns.name: SystemNumber
columns.description: The SystemNumber is a two-digit number that identifies a specific SAP system. It is set during the installation of an SAP system and cannot be changed afterwards. The SystemNumber is used in various SAP transactions and configuration settings to identify the system and ensure that the correct system is being accessed or configured.

columns.name: ClientId
columns.description: The ClientId is a three-digit number that identifies a specific client within an SAP system. The ClientId is used in various SAP transactions and configuration settings to identify the client and ensure that the correct client is being accessed or configured.

columns.name: Instance
columns.description: The Instance refers to a specific installation of an SAP system on a server. An SAP system can have multiple instances running on the same server, each with its own set of processes and resources. The Instance is identified by a unique name that is set during the installation of the SAP system, following syntax: <HOST>_<SYSID>_<SYSNR>.

columns.name: AuditClassId
columns.description: The AuditClassId is a numeric identifier used to classify different types of audit events in SAP. It helps group similar events together and is used in various transactions and reports to provide information about audit events and to help with auditing and compliance requirements.

columns.name: MonitoringObjectName
columns.description: The MonitoringObjectName is the name of the object being monitored by a specific monitoring activity. It is used in various SAP monitoring tools and reports to provide information about the status and performance of the monitored object.

columns.name: SalDateChar8
columns.description: The SalDateChar8 is the date the event occured in char8 format (yyyyMMdd) eg: 20190101.

columns.name: SalTimeChar6
columns.description: The SalTimeChar6 is the time the event occured in char6 format (hhMMss) eg: 110804.

columns.name: MonitorShortName
columns.description: The MonitorShortName is the short name of the MTE(Monitoring Tree Element) in which the alert occurred.

columns.name: MessageId
columns.description: The MessageId is a unique identifier for a specific message or log entry used to identify and track messages and log entries within an SAP system.

columns.name: MessageText
columns.description: The MessageText is the text of a specific message or log entry. It provides information about the event or issue that is being logged and is used in various SAP transactions and reports to provide context and details about specific messages or log entries.

columns.name: MessageClass
columns.description: The MessageClass is a grouping or category for specific messages or log entries used to organize and classify messages and log entries within an SAP system.

columns.name: MessageContainerId
columns.description: The MessageContainerId is a unique identifier for a specific message container, which is a logical grouping of related messages or log entries within an SAP system.

columns.name: AlertValue
columns.description: The AlertValue represents the importance of the message of a log attribute, characterized by color and severity.

columns.name: AlertSeverity
columns.description: The AlertSeverity is a number between 0 and 255; the larger the number, the greater the severity.

columns.name: AlertSeverityText
columns.description: The AlertSeverityText refers to the text description associated with a specific alert or notification severity level. It provides a detailed explanation of the severity level and is used in various SAP transactions and reports.

columns.name: User
columns.description: The User who performed the a specific event or activity.

columns.name: TransactionCode
columns.description: the TransactionCode is a unique identifier for a specific SAP transaction used to identify and execute a specific transaction within the SAP system. It is typically a four-character alphanumeric code and can be used in various SAP transactions and reports.

columns.name: AbapProgramName
columns.description: The AbapProgramName is a four-character alphanumeric code that is used identify a specific program within the SAP system.

columns.name: SapProcessType
columns.description: The SapProcessType refers to the type of process that is being executed within the SAP system. This can include various types of processes such as background jobs, dialog processes, or update processes.

columns.name: SapWorkProcessName
columns.description: The SapWorkProcessName refers to the name of a specific work process within the SAP system used to identify and monitor specific work processes. It is typically a unique alphanumeric code.

columns.name: Email
columns.description: The Email refers to the email address associated with a specific user. It is used to identify the user via email within the SAP system.

columns.name: Host
columns.description: The Host refers to the name of the computer or server on which the SAP system is running. It is used to identify and locate the SAP system within a network.

columns.name: Computer
columns.description: The Computer refers to the name or IP address of the user's machine. It is used to identify the machine from which a specific activity or event was performed.

columns.name: SalIpAddress
columns.description: The SALIpAddress refers to the IP address associated with a specific user or system that generated a specific log entry.

columns.name: TerminalIpV6
columns.description: The TerminalIPv6 refers to the IPv6 address associated with the user's terminal or device. It is used to identify the location and origin of specific activities or events performed by the user within the SAP system.

columns.name: Variable1
columns.description: The Variable1 used by the SAP system for additional information regarding the event or activity that was performed.

columns.name: Variable2
columns.description: The Variable2 used by the SAP system for additional information regarding the event or activity that was performed.

columns.name: Variable3
columns.description: The Variable3 used by the SAP system for additional information regarding the event or activity that was performed.

columns.name: Variable4
columns.description: The Variable4 used by the SAP system for additional information regarding the event or activity that was performed.

columns.name: SystemRole
columns.description: The SAP system's role.

columns.name: SystemUniqueId
columns.description: Unique system identifier.

columns.name: AgentId
columns.description: Unique agent or integration suite identifier.

columns.name: RemoteIpLongitude
columns.description: The Longitude of the TerminalIpV6 according to the GEO information at the time of the record ingestion.

columns.name: RemoteIpLatitude
columns.description: The Latitude of the TerminalIpV6 according to the GEO information at the time of the record ingestion.

columns.name: RemoteIpCountry
columns.description: The country of the TerminalIpV6 according to the GEO information at the time of the record ingestion.

tables.name: ABAPChangeDocsLog
tables.description: SAP NetWeaver Application Server ABAP logs changes to business data objects in change documents. This table stores information about the changes made to business objects, including the user who made the change, the date and time of the change, and the type of change that was made.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Date and time when the record was generated.

columns.name: UpdatedOn
columns.description: The date and time of the event occured in the SAP system in UTC format.

columns.name: SystemId
columns.description: The SystemId is a unique identifier for a specific SAP system. It is a three-character alphanumeric code that is used to distinguish between different SAP systems.

columns.name: SystemNumber
columns.description: The SystemNumber is a two-digit number that identifies a specific SAP system. It is set during the installation of an SAP system and cannot be changed afterwards. The SystemNumber is used in various SAP transactions and configuration settings to identify the system and ensure that the correct system is being accessed or configured.

columns.name: ClientId
columns.description: The ClientId is a three-digit number that identifies a specific client within an SAP system. The ClientId is used in various SAP transactions and configuration settings to identify the client and ensure that the correct client is being accessed or configured.

columns.name: Instance
columns.description: The Instance refers to a specific installation of an SAP system on a server. An SAP system can have multiple instances running on the same server, each with its own set of processes and resources. The Instance is identified by a unique name that is set during the installation of the SAP system, following syntax: <HOST>_<SYSID>_<SYSNR>.

columns.name: User
columns.description: The User who performed the a specific event or activity.

columns.name: SystemRole
columns.description: The SAP system's role.

columns.name: SystemUniqueId
columns.description: Unique system identifier.

columns.name: AgentId
columns.description: Unique agent or integration suite identifier.

columns.name: ActualChangeNumber
columns.description: Actual change number.

columns.name: ChangedTableKey
columns.description: Changed table key.

columns.name: ChangeNumber
columns.description: Document change number.

columns.name: CreatedFromPlannedChange
columns.description: Created from planned change, in the following syntax:('X' , ' ').

columns.name: CurrencyKeyNew
columns.description: Currency key: new value.

columns.name: CurrencyKeyOld
columns.description: Currency key: old value.

columns.name: FieldName
columns.description: Field name.

columns.name: FlagText
columns.description: Flag text.

columns.name: Language
columns.description: Document language.

columns.name: ObjectClass
columns.description: Object class, such as BELEG, BPAR, PFCG, IDENTITY.

columns.name: ObjectId
columns.description: Object ID.

columns.name: PlannedChangeNumber
columns.description: Planned change number.

columns.name: TableName
columns.description: Table name.

columns.name: TransactionCode
columns.description: Transaction code.

columns.name: HeaderTypeOfChange
columns.description: Header type of change, including: U = Change; I = Insert; E = Delete Single Docu; D = Delete; J = Insert Single Docu.

columns.name: ItemTypeOfChange
columns.description: Item type of change, including: U = Change; I = Insert; E = Delete Single Docu; D = Delete; J = Insert Single Docu.

columns.name: UOMNew
columns.description: Unit of measure: new value.

columns.name: UOMOld
columns.description: Unit of measure: old value.

columns.name: ValueNew
columns.description: Field content: new value.

columns.name: ValueOld
columns.description: Field content: old value.

columns.name: Version
columns.description: Document change version.

tables.name: ABAPUserDetails
tables.description: SAP User details, such as roles and profiles assigned.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Date and time when the record was sent to Sentinel.

columns.name: User
columns.description: SAP User.

columns.name: UserGroup
columns.description: SAP User group.

columns.name: Email
columns.description: Email address.

columns.name: UserType
columns.description: User Type (dialog, system).

columns.name: Timezone
columns.description: User default Time zone.

columns.name: LockedStatus
columns.description: Locked status: 0: Not Locked, 32: Locked Globally By Administrator, 64: Locked Locally By Administrator, 128: Locked Due To Incorrect Logons.

columns.name: LastSeen
columns.description: User last logon.

columns.name: CreatedOn
columns.description: Day on which user was created.

columns.name: ChangedOn
columns.description: Last changed on date and time.

columns.name: ValidityDate
columns.description: Last valid day for login in.

columns.name: LastChangedBy
columns.description: Last changed by.

columns.name: Profiles
columns.description: List of profiles generated for the user.

columns.name: Roles
columns.description: List of roles assigned to user.

columns.name: SystemId
columns.description: The SystemId is a unique identifier for a specific SAP system. It is a three-character alphanumeric code that is used to distinguish between different SAP systems.

columns.name: ClientId
columns.description: The ClientId is a three-digit number that identifies a specific client within an SAP system. The ClientId is used in various SAP transactions and configuration settings to identify the client and ensure that the correct client is being accessed or configured.

columns.name: SystemRole
columns.description: The SAP system's role.

columns.name: SystemUniqueId
columns.description: Unique system identifier.

columns.name: AgentId
columns.description: Unique agent or integration suite identifier.

tables.name: ABAPTableDataLog
tables.description: SAP NetWeaver Application Server ABAP logs changes to tables. This log stores information about the changes made to selected tables, including the user who made the change, the date and time of the change, and the type of change that was made.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Date and time when the record was generated.

columns.name: UpdatedOn
columns.description: The date and time of the event occured in the SAP system in UTC format.

columns.name: SystemId
columns.description: The SystemId is a unique identifier for a specific SAP system. It is a three-character alphanumeric code that is used to distinguish between different SAP systems.

columns.name: SystemNumber
columns.description: The SystemNumber is a two-digit number that identifies a specific SAP system. It is set during the installation of an SAP system and cannot be changed afterwards. The SystemNumber is used in various SAP transactions and configuration settings to identify the system and ensure that the correct system is being accessed or configured.

columns.name: Instance
columns.description: The Instance refers to a specific installation of an SAP system on a server. An SAP system can have multiple instances running on the same server, each with its own set of processes and resources. The Instance is identified by a unique name that is set during the installation of the SAP system, following syntax: <HOST>_<SYSID>_<SYSNR>.

columns.name: ClientId
columns.description: The ClientId is a three-digit number that identifies a specific client within an SAP system. The ClientId is used in various SAP transactions and configuration settings to identify the client and ensure that the correct client is being accessed or configured.

columns.name: User
columns.description: The User who performed the a specific event or activity.

columns.name: SystemRole
columns.description: The SAP system's role.

columns.name: SystemUniqueId
columns.description: Unique system identifier.

columns.name: AgentId
columns.description: Unique agent or integration suite identifier.

columns.name: DBLogId
columns.description: The unique identifier of the database log.

columns.name: LogKey
columns.description: The unique identifier of the log key.

columns.name: Host
columns.description: The hostname of the SAP system.

columns.name: TransactionCode
columns.description: The transaction code of the event.

columns.name: Program
columns.description: The program that was executed.

columns.name: OperationTypeSQL
columns.description: The type of operation that was performed, such as insert, update and delete.

columns.name: VersionNumber
columns.description: The version number of the event.

columns.name: Language
columns.description: The language of the event.

columns.name: TableName
columns.description: The name of the table that produced the change.

columns.name: TableField
columns.description: The field of the table that produced the change.

columns.name: OldValue
columns.description: The old value of the field.

columns.name: NewValue
columns.description: The new value of the field.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Date and time when the record was generated

columns.name: Role
columns.description: The SAP role name.

columns.name: RoleType
columns.description: Single or composite role

columns.name: UpdatedOn
columns.description: The date and time when the role was last updated.

columns.name: TypeOfChange
columns.description: I and J for insert, U for update, D and E for deletion.

columns.name: Authorization
columns.description: The authorization identifier.

columns.name: AuthorizationGroup
columns.description: The authorization group.

columns.name: Object
columns.description: The authorization object name.

columns.name: Field
columns.description: The authorization field name.

columns.name: Low
columns.description: The low value of the authorization field.

columns.name: High
columns.description: The high value of the authorization field.

columns.name: ChildRole
columns.description: The child role name, if the role is a composite one.

columns.description: The SystemId is a unique identifier for a specific SAP system. It is a three-character alphanumeric code that is used to distinguish between different SAP systems.
